transcript.content: I'm in a- I'm in a bad mood
I've been here three minutes and I'm already annoyed.
Bring back Claire, I tell you.
-it's the whole place. The library's sh-shite, I tried to ge-- Oh God. I had to g-
I had to go to Capital library, er, oh-

Fancy that, I had to go to Capital library to get a couple of records I wanted, right? Place is falling apart, the email's not working, it's so shoddy. He's had two weeks off. "Ooh, I'm on holiday." I mean, they, really, they might as well bulldoze this, honestly. 'Cause for all the- you know.
Ah, and it really annoys me that you have to fight t- ah, anyway.
-I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Karl, you're back.
Well, it wasn't all fun was it, because me dad was in, er, was in hospital.
-not during the holiday though, was he? You came back from holiday and then found that out, didn't you?
Yeah, but it happened when I was on holiday.
Did you know that though, When you were on holiday?
No, 'cos I didn't take me phone with me.
But the weird thing is, I got- I got a feeling. When I was sat there. 'Cos it normally happens-
It wasn't the nudist beach was it?
When you saw that old fella with his packet out?
-when I went to Ibiza, right. I, er, I had a feeling, and I called home and me dad had punctured a lung.
When you say you had a feeling, what do you mean, a feeling?
Just like "Oh, I should call home, there's something not right."
Mmm. That's a very specific feeling, how did that ma-
How does that- how do you get that? What kind of feeling is that-
Was it- was it- "Oh God, I'm getting-
-I'm getting a bit of a lung feeling.
A bit of a dad lung feeling
That feels like- that feels like a punctured lung, mmm.
No, but anyway, holiday was good. We talked about it last... week anyway.
Let's- let's probe Karl about his holiday later-
-'cos, you know, that's the sort of thing that audiences will stay tuned for Rick, I'm pretty certain.
You know more about this radio business than me-
Well, also I'm thinking, we've got nothing.
So- we may aswell save that.
No, I resent it. I used to put a lot of work in, but now, I, you know, I think of the money, which is, you know, for me, pretty shoddy.
You know what I mean? I don't usually get out of bed for-
-you make an awful lot of cash.
Well exactly, yeah. And er, you know, and the whole thing, the whole setup... It was raining today, I thought, "I should have a cab in."
You know, and then the sun came out so I walked in again.
But, erm, I'll tell you what, I got a bit criticised last week as well, that I- I only played ballads and same songs, so I'm gonna- I'm gonna rock out this week.
I've been down to the Capital library-
-to get some good tunes, and er, what about a little bit of AC/DC?
AC/DC - You Shook Me All Night Long
That's great. Shall we- shall we rock out... today?
Bit of Led Zep maybe. Stones.
Brilliant, yeah. Some of the classics, no doubt.
Yeah. When are we gonna talk about Karl?
Have we run out of stuff already?
So where did you go Karl? What was the story?
Erm, it was me birthday, right, erm, went home after doing- working with you a couple of Saturdays ago.
Right, err, girlfriend was like "Open your card, open your card." and I said "No, it's me birthday on Monday, I'll open it then."
You obey by the rules, don't you, of birthdays-
Well exactly, chaos lead that way.
Not an anarchist, never has been.
So anyway, sh- she was kept going on- and it was doing me head in so I said "Alright, I'll open it."
So I opened it, ticket fell out. Err, surprise holiday to one of the Canary Islands... So...
And what was your reaction? I mean-
First one was "We haven't got enough money... for this"
But I didn't want to ruin it, so...
So- so I didn't go on about that. And I said "Oh, it'll be great." I said "I can't wait."
Did you say it in that tone of voice?
Well, it was good timing, because I was tired and everything-
-and err, I'm not a big holiday fan-
-do you know what I mean? It's the same as last night, I don't always like a curry but last night-
Curry feel- you had- you had- you got a feeling-
A feeling, yeah, you had a feeling for curry.
-and you thought "Hold on."- and then lo and behold, later you were eating the curry.
They- they work in mysterious ways, ghosts.
-erm, the island, erm, if I was on Wish You Were Here, I'd probably say it's a bit barren...
-but if you get a hotel, you're guaranteed good weather. Right.
That's great. Shall we- shall we rock out... today?
Bit of Led Zep maybe. Stones.
Brilliant, yeah. Some of the classics, no doubt.

-it'll be a good holiday. If you get a hotel, right, the weather's always good. So your- so- so you'll have a nice time.
Yeah, there was a comma, yeah.
Erm, and all that, and the food was alright. And err, and everything was going alright, I was just having a nice, relaxing... time.
And how do you sort of spend your time on a holiday? You just lie around? Is that-
That sort of holiday just lying around, I- I bought a book.
No, it was- it was short stories, right-
No, it was about, like, err, like, special days in our time, and time before me.
And it was like, err, it was telling you about how in, I think it was 1814, the Thames frozen up.
And all these stories are told by eye- eye witnesses.
Right, so there was some fella who was around in 1814, and, err, the Thames was frozen, and people used to, err, put market stalls on there-
-and they'd do their shopping, and it was like- it was like an Oxford Street.
Yeah, I think that was Mad Liar Charlie.
Right, so I was reading that and then after a couple of days I was a bit like "Oh..."
Yeah, you can do- you can only do sort of so much lying around.
So, err, Suzanne said "Well, let's go on the beach, have a walk."
You hadn't gone on the beach?
Where had to been up to this point then? In the- In your room?
No, just like, around the pool, just- just relaxing-
Erm, so she said "Well, let's go on the beach." and I said "Oh, alright then, yeah." So, err, wandered down to the beach, and, err, first impressions are "Yeah, it's alright. It's clean."
Your criteria is so basic, it's brilliant.
"Hotel, yes, roof, good, food, adequate, beach, clean. Next."
So, I'm walking along, and everything's good and, err, you know, there's a woman, err, feeding fish bread, which I thought "Well, that's different."
Ricky and Steve burst out laughing
I love that. He likes originality. He loves a bit of originality.
This woman was there, like up to her- up to her knees in water-
-chucking- yeah- ch-chucking this bread and I thought "What's she doing?" and I stood there and watched for a minute-
-and there was little fish coming up, having the bread. I thought "Ah."
So we c- we carried on walking, and err, everything's going well, and then this fella comes towards me-
"Clean- clean, feeding bread, ah, two points for originality. Yeah, yeah."
So I said "Suzanne, what's going on?"
Why does he turn to her? Like she knows more.
So she said- so she said "Oh, yeah, yeah, it's err..." She said "Yeah, it's a nudist beach."
Is this going to be a long story, cos could- could you pour that coffee? Could you give me that coffee over?
Sorry- sorry, this is really bad. Ugh, yeah, cos he's pour- thank you.
I'll have a cup of coffee Karl, thanks, yeah, cheers.
Ricky sips his cup of coffee

So, she said "Yeah, it's a, err- it's a nudist beach." So I said "Well, why- wha-" I said "We're all mixed- mix- it's all mixed up." Normally on a nudist beach- it's a nudist beach innit, you don't go wandering on there when you've got your clothes on an' that.
So, it annoyed me a bit, cos there wasn't any signs. So this fella is getting closer-
Well the knob out was a sign.
Yeah. Right, so he's getting closer, and he walked past me, it was an old fella, err, and he walked past and he had a hat on and, err, and a little pipe-
-and a big rucksack on his back. Right, so it got me think-
-I'm walking along and I'm thinking 'Right, why do people wanna do this?'. So straight away he was- I wasn't on holiday anymore, cos most of the time when i'm on holiday I don't think about anything.
Right. But all- all of a sudden this- this has got in me head now, and I've turned round to- to look at him, and-
-and the bag- and this bag, right, I swear, it was-

When I said- he said there's an old couple coming towards me, I said "What was lower, the bloke's testicles or the woman's tits?" and he said "That was another point, she might as well have wore knickers."
Cos it's so low- he could see- that's what he said, to me.
So it annoyed me, yeah, because the whole idea innit- ah- this is what I think- I mean I might be wrong, right-
Being nudist, right, what's it all about?
Ricky and Steve hold back more laughter
Tell you what, on that- on that.. point, Karl, let's play a tune- let's come back, and we'll discuss-

Alright. Well, we'll play the Coral...

well, what I don't understand is right. Nudity, I thought it was all about...you know, sort of being free.
..Natural, letting the breeze, you know, blow around you an' that.. tha-that's the only thing I can think is-of-of like the bonus of doing it

But. You can get that, by just having a pair of shorts on, alright? Coz, I-I'm not one for gettin me kit off. It's just something, a bit weird about it, innit normally, if I go for a walk on the beach, I'll...I'll put a shirt on
